Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2011 10:18AM webstertoo wrote: Part B pays for some drugs if given in a doctor's office.  Call medicare to verify this. You will still have to pay 20% or so of the cost.  Good luck.

Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2010 01:02PM webstertoo wrote: My Oncologist said that for the next three years I would see either her or the RO every three months.  I asked my RO what would be done at his appointments and he said he would check my breast and then listen to me about my health and any concerns that I might have.  Since he never listened to me during treatment, I see no reason to go back for more of the same.  My oncologist can check me every quarter.
Posts.Title: December 2009 Rads Group Linda_NJ BonnieSF

Posts.Content: webstertoo wrote: Six months after LUMP and SNB and three months after radiation I noticed swelling in my breast and it was warm to the touch.  My surgeon called it edema and said my breast now was "My new normal". After reading here I asked for a script to an LE specialist.  She also said it's just "edema" because Lymphedema doesn't cause the breast to be so warm but doesn't know why I still have fluid in the breast eight months after surgery.  Has anyone else had this.  It's worst on hot and humid days. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Not Lymphedema Just Edema webstertoo Binney4

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2009 09:59AM webstertoo wrote: I had my first session yesterday and this morning I noticed the area around the nipple had already changed.  I was told that I shouldn't have any side affects so wonder what's going on.  Only 1 minute of radiation to two sides of breast with around five minutes of setup.  I'm only 15 minutes from the hospital so very lucky.
Posts.Title: December 2009 Rads Group Linda_NJ BonnieSF

Posts.Content: Dec 14, 2009 10:07AM webstertoo wrote: Today will be number 10.  Based on what I read here I asked my doctor:  I was told vitamins were fine with the exception of large doses of C, any deodorante was OK, any creme two times a day but not four hours before treatment, don't use wash cloth on the breast and use 1% hydrocortisone for the red bumps (what ever they will be). I found last week that I fell asleep in the afternoon for about 10 minutes.  I see just a little pink.  The breast was very hot after the first treatment and I saw changes around the nipple which the RO said wasn't there.  Changes still there  but no longer so warm. The only things my techs ever say to me is "What's your birth date" and "Don't move"  I've had no pain in my arm being over head but I wear a padded glove to protect the back of my hand (no fat there) and it works.  I hate the pulling and pushing, especially since they say nothing to me when they do it, except "Don't move!"  Off to another 15 minutes of fun.
Posts.Title: December 2009 Rads Group Linda_NJ BonnieSF

Posts.Content: Jun 16, 2010 08:38AM webstertoo wrote: Thanks Kira.  I hadn't seen anyone mention the warmth and having it is why the LE therapist said it wasn't Lymphedema.
Posts.Title: Not Lymphedema Just Edema webstertoo Binney4

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2010 10:14AM webstertoo wrote: Today is my last day!!  Spring can't be far behind.  I started Arimidex in November, prior to radiation. Wasn't able to put weight on left hip without pain in the beginning but I'm now back to using the treadmill so the pain is much improved.  I've had no hot flashes but I'm 65 and really didn't have bad ones back in my late 40's.
Posts.Title: December 2009 Rads Group Linda_NJ BonnieSF

Posts.Content: webstertoo wrote: Both my surgeon and oncologist said that that the swelling in my breast was edema and neither seemed concerned.  I came home and of course, searched the interenet and found that if my bra leaves mark on breast I should buy larger size (it does), that I shouldn't wear ones with underwires ( I do),and so on.  I called and got a script for a therapist but it might me months before I see one.  It's not causing pain at this time but I don't want it to get worse if there are things that I could  do on my own. Any suggestions.  I heard about special bras and there's a store near me.  Thanks. My sentienel nodes were removed from my breast., not from the arm. Log in to post a reply
